value.title: Explore natural language processing
value.excerpt: Natural language processing supports applications that can see, hear, speak with, and understand users.  They permit the user to interact with your application in natural ways without requiring the user to adapt to the computer model.  Using text analytics, translation, and language understanding services, Microsoft Azure makes it easy to build applications that support natural language.

topItems.title: Analyze text with the Text Analytics service
topItems.excerpt: The Text Analytics service is a cloud-based service that provides advanced natural language processing over raw text for sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, named entity recognition, and language detection.

topItems.title: Recognize and synthesize speech
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to recognize and synthesize speech by using Azure Cognitive Services.

topItems.title: Translate text and speech
topItems.excerpt: Automated translation capabilities in an AI solution enables closer collaboration by removing language barriers.

topItems.title: Create a language model with Language Understanding
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) and show how to build and publish a LUIS model.

value.title: Introduction to Kubernetes on Azure
value.excerpt: Learn about the basics of Docker containers, container orchestration with Kubernetes, and managed clusters on Azure Kubernetes Service.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to Docker containers

topItems.title: Introduction to Kubernetes
topItems.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Kubernetes open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure Kubernetes open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

topItems.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application by using Azure Kubernetes Service declarative manifest files.

value.title: Protect identity and access with Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: The **Identity and Access learning path** covers the latest identity and access technologies, tools for strengthening authentication, and guidance on identity protection within your organization. Microsoft access and identity technologies enable you to secure your organization’s identity, whether it is on-premises or in the cloud, and empower your users to work securely from any location.

topItems.title: Define identity and access management in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about identity and access management in Azure Active Directory and why identity is a core component of your organization’s security posture.

topItems.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about identity governance and how you can safeguard access to your organization’s data.

topItems.title: Strengthen authentication (conditional access) with Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about modern authentication and the security benefits it provides to your organization, such as enabling multi-factor authentication and a passwordless environment.

topItems.title: Secure administrator accounts in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn about securing administrator accounts through secure devices, dedicated administrator accounts, and just-in-time privileges.

value.title: Work with relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to Azure-supported SQL-based enterprise data solutions enabling you to store and retrieve your app's data in the cloud.

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Find out what makes Azure SQL Database a good choice for your relational database, how to create the database from the portal and connect with Azure Cloud Shell.

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: This module is a no-code introduction to PostgreSQL on Azure, including an explanation of particular problems that using Azure Database for PostgreSQL can solve. At a high level, we show how the components fit together and identify situations where you should use Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

topItems.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

value.title: Explore core data concepts
value.excerpt: Explore core data concepts

value.title: Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Join Scott Hanselman, Donovan Brown, and Lara Rubbelke as they host the engineers who build & use Azure, demo it, answer questions, and share insights.

topItems.title: Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes with GitOps | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: Lior Kamrat shows Scott Hanselman how Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes provides an easy way to apply GitOps configurations on Kubernetes clusters deployed outside of Azure, which enables you to control and govern those clusters and applications using GitHub repositories as the "single source of truth."
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4fT47TKprFQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Migrate and modernize your .NET applications on Azure | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: Azure App Service hosts over 2M web apps with a fully managed app hosting platform for .NET, Node, Python, and Java web apps. In this episode, Gaurav Seth shows Scott Hanselman what's new in Azure App Service. Gaurav demos the new Premium V3 Plan with newer and faster hardware and lower pricing, ability
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qhrEPvZgFMQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Code to Cloud with VS Code and Docker | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: After a quick demo of working with Docker images in Visual Studio, Paul Yuknewicz shows Scott Hanselman how the Docker for Visual Studio Code extension makes it easy for you to build, debug, and diagnose containerized apps. Paul will also show how the extension helps you deploy a container to Azure Container
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zx-rXxvbdyM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Implement serverless APIs with Azure Functions and Azure API Management | Azure Friday
topItems.excerpt: Jeff Hollan joins Scott Hanselman to show how you can quickly deploy and manage your Serverless API's using OpenAPI and API Management.  0:00 – Overview 0:40 – OpenAPI definition (fka Swagger) 2:15 – Using API Management to build an OpenAPI definition 3:48 – Reviewing the generated OpenAPI definition

value.title: Azure Portal “How To” Series
value.excerpt: Welcome to our weekly series that highlights specific aspects of the Azure portal so you can be more efficient and productive while deploying your cloud workloads from the portal.

topItems.title: How to get a visualization view of your resources | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to easily view a summary of your resources using different visualizations such as how to view all your resources on a map.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

topItems.title: How to manage applications in Azure Kubernetes Service | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to use the new Kubernetes resources view experience for #Azure Kubernetes Service to quickly deploy and debug your Kubernetes applications. topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, you will learn how to get started with your first project in #Azure using the Azure Quickstart Center. topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

value.title: Architect API integration in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about using an Azure API gateway to share APIs with partners, and how to use subscription keys to control access to your APIs.

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure API Management to change an API without rewriting code to enable you to apply a caching policy to a GET operation for quicker response.

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.

value.title: Architect migration, business continuity, and disaster recovery in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to migrate resources to Azure, how to provide site recovery for your applications in Azure and on-premises, and how to your applications are available through service interruptions and changes in load.

topItems.title: Design your migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Migrate and Azure Database Migration Service.

topItems.title: Protect your on-premises infrastructure from disasters with Azure Site Recovery
topItems.excerpt: Provide disaster recovery for your on-premises infrastructure by managing and orchestrating replication, failover, and failback of VMware virtual machines, Hyper-V virtual machines, and physical servers with Azure Site Recovery.

topItems.title: Protect your Azure infrastructure with Azure Site Recovery
topItems.excerpt: Provide disaster recovery for your Azure infrastructure by managing and orchestrating replication, failover, and failback of Azure virtual machines with Azure Site Recovery.

topItems.title: Protect your virtual machines by using Azure Backup
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Backup to help protect the data for on-premises servers, virtual machines, virtualized workloads, SQL Server, Azure Files, and more.

value.title: AZ-104: Monitor and back up Azure resources
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and back up Azure resources and prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

topItems.title: Monitor the health of your Azure virtual machine by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to monitor the health of your Azure VMs by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts.

topItems.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

topItems.title: Monitor performance of virtual machines by using Azure Monitor for VMs
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Monitor for VMs to monitor your organization's Azure virtual machines.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: AZ-400: Manage source control
value.excerpt: Use GitHub to build a modern source control strategy and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to move your existing project to GitHub from a legacy version control system.

topItems.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

topItems.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

value.title: Build applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to collaborate with others to continuously build, test, and verify your applications using Azure Pipelines and GitHub.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Implement a code workflow in your build pipeline by using Git and GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn along with the Space Game web team the benefits of collaboration through Visual Studio Code and GitHub.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Scan open-source components for security vulnerabilities and assess their license ratings when your application builds in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Build great solutions with the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how to design and build secure, scalable, high-performing solutions in Azure using the pillars of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

value.title: Build JavaScript applications with Node.js
value.excerpt: Node.js provides a large set of built-in APIs that help you build various types of applications, command-line apps, web apps, and more. It also offers testing and debugging capabilities and a rich ecosystem of third-party packages that you can easily add to your application.

topItems.title: Introduction to Node.js
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Node.js: what it is, how it works, and when to use it. Create Node.js applications using JavaScript/TypeScript using Visual Studio Code.

topItems.title: Create a new Node.js project and work with dependencies
topItems.excerpt: Create a Node.js project and learn to add packages and manage package dependencies in your project. Use the NPM CLI and registry to add libraries and tools to your JavaScript/TypeScript applications using Visual Studio Code.

topItems.title: Interactively debug Node.js apps with the built-in and Visual Studio Code debuggers
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to efficiently debug your Node.js app by using Visual Studio Code to fix your bugs quickly. Use the interactive debugger within Visual Studio Code to analyze and fix your JavaScript/TypeScript applications.

topItems.title: Work with files and directories in a Node.js app
topItems.excerpt: Build an app that manipulates files and directories with Node.js and JavaScript.

value.title: Cloud-native security operations with Azure Sentinel
value.excerpt: This learning path describes basic architecture, core capabilities, and primary use cases of its products. You'll also learn about differences and Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Sentinel
topItems.excerpt: Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure Sentinel and connect data sources
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Azure Sentinel and connect the services you want to monitor. Then you can use Azure and AI to provide analysis of security alerts.

topItems.title: Threat detection with Azure Sentinel analytics
topItems.excerpt: Threat detection with Azure Sentinel analytics

topItems.title: Security incident management in Azure Sentinel
topItems.excerpt: Security incident management in Azure Sentinel

value.title: Control Azure spending and manage bills with Azure Cost Management + Billing
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and control your Azure spending and optimize the use of Azure resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

topItems.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
topItems.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

topItems.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use cost analysis to understand how your costs accrue each month.

topItems.title: Save money with Azure Reserved Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use plan for, buy, and manage Azure reservations to save money.

value.title: Create an enterprise-scale architecture in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore how to create Azure landing zone architecture at enterprise scale.

topItems.title: Introduction to enterprise-scale landing zones in the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure provides many landing zone options. In this module, we'll focus on enterprise-scale landing zones.

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Enabling digital transformation
topItems.excerpt: Digital transformation is a wave of business innovation fueled by the explosion of technology—data, applications, and devices are everywhere. The cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT) give organizations new ways to make sense of information and generate insights to transform their business. Realizing the benefits of digital transformation requires business leaders to look beyond technology to reimagine existing business models and embrace a different way of bringing together people, data, and processes to create value for customers.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

value.title: Java on Azure
value.excerpt: Start here and learn how you can build, migrate and scale Java applications on Azure leveraging Azure services, and using tools and frameworks that you know and love – Spring, Tomcat, WildFly, JBoss, WebLogic, WebSphere, Maven, Gradle, IntelliJ, Eclipse, Jenkins, Terraform etc.

topItems.title: Introduction to Java on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Goal of this module is to welcome you as Java Developers on Azure. In this module, you'll begin to discover the opportunities for Java developers on Azure.

topItems.title: Choose an Azure service for deploying your Java application
topItems.excerpt: In this tutorial, you'll learn about running your Java applications on Azure, and choose the best option between Virtual Machines, Azure App Services, Serverless functions, Kubernetes and Azure Spring Cloud.

topItems.title: Create and deploy a data-driven Spring Boot Java application to Azure App Service with Spring Initializr and Maven
topItems.excerpt: Create a Spring Boot application, connect it to a MySQL database and then deploy to Azure App Service.

topItems.title: Deploy a Java web app to Azure
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn how to create a Java web application and deploy it to Azure App Service.

value.title: Migrate application workloads and data to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate application workloads and data to Azure

topItems.title: Design your migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Minimize the time and resources required to migrate your on-premises environment to Azure. Assess your current systems with Azure Migrate, and migrate them with Azure Migrate and Azure Database Migration Service.

topItems.title: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Monitor and back up resources for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to monitor and back up Azure resources.

topItems.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

topItems.title: Monitor the health of your Azure virtual machine by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to monitor the health of your Azure VMs by using Azure Metrics Explorer and metric alerts.

topItems.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

topItems.title: Monitor performance of virtual machines by using Azure Monitor for VMs
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Monitor for VMs to monitor your organization's Azure virtual machines.

value.title: SAP certified offerings for Azure
value.excerpt: As an IT Professional experienced in SAP solutions, you need to learn about how to leverage Azure resources that include virtual machines, virtual networks, storage accounts, and Azure AD. These modules will give you the Azure knowledge around SAP Workloads, the certified offerings in Azure, and how to utilize IAAS support for your SAP workloads.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: With the recently expanded partnership between Microsoft and SAP, you can run SAP applications across development, test, and production scenarios in Azure, taking advantage of the scalability, flexibility, and cost savings of Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Deploy SAP certified offerings on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a scalable, compliant, and enterprise-proven platform for a range of SAP workloads. In this module, you explore the platform compliance criteria that is stipulated by SAP before deploying SAP solutions in Azure, and look at the different options for deploying SAP in Azure.

topItems.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: There are a variety of commonly used SAP-certified operating systems supported by SAP running on Azure VMs, and there are also several different methods of provisioning storage for SAP workloads in Azure. In this module, you will learn the SAP recommended support products and VM types as well as the network, database, and monitoring requirements.

topItems.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage
topItems.excerpt: AP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) provides virtual machines for deploying and running SAP HANA. This module explores the SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) solution that builds on assigned, non -shared host/server bare -metal hardware.

value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to customize NoSQL data storage and distribution with the Azure portal, Cosmos DB extension, and Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

topItems.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

topItems.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
topItems.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

topItems.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
topItems.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: AI business school for education
value.excerpt: Learn to develop an AI strategy to create value in government, including artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, culture, and responsible AI.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an enterprise AI strategy that creates real business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in education
topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, special factors, and use cases of an AI strategy in education that creates value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

topItems.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
topItems.excerpt: Understand the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and a framework to drive the change needed in your organization for a successful AI strategy.

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: Learn the necessary cultural changes for enterprise finance organizations to make AI transformation successful, and how they fit into a holistic AI strategy.

value.title: AI business school for financial services
value.excerpt: Learn to develop an enterprise AI strategy to create business value in financial services, including machine learning technologies, and culture.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an enterprise AI strategy that creates real business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.
